# Professional blurb

I'm a product professional who has specialised in solving for gaps in growing markets.

I'm now also a trusted adult educator, experiential learning designer, and vocational skills advocate.

I'm highly regarded for my breadth of skills, insights, and translation of ideas into hi- and low-tech ventures and products for persistent and emergent needs.

## Quote

"Ian is a deep thinker who is always one step ahead of the market. I have admired his remarkable ability to recognise global trends and predict where technology is headed. He demonstrates strong leadership skills and the ability to influence executives in a positive way. Best of all, Ian is a kind and fun person to be around."

— Karen Knott, General Manager - Corporate Communications, Fisher & Paykel Healthcare

## Bio

Born and raised in Gisborne before making that northward drift.

I returned a few years ago in a family caravan and have since been doing up a dunga of a house, teaching adults, and advocating for strong public vocational education.

Oh, and I recently stepped out to run for the Gisborne District Council. I didn't make it, but left a decent impression and a useful collection of thinking.

## Qualifications & Awards

  • Bachelor of Computing & Mathematical Sciences (Hons), Graphics & Multimedia, University of Waikato
  • Certificate in Adult and Tertiary Teaching, Open Polytechnic
  • Tertiary Education Union co-Branch President, EIT
  • Patent: Method and system for conducting a money transfer and/or payment transaction
  • NZ Hi-Tech Award: Most Innovative Initiative - Pond, Network for Learning (Product Development Lead)
  • Connected World Forum: Best NFC Deployment (Product Designer)

## Into

  • Falling in love with the problem
  • Rewilding the Internet
  • Revaluing craftsmanship
  • Meatspace community
  • The political economy
  • Indie things - web, music, design, products, retail
